content.content: I have used CoinList for a long time to wrap BTC to WBTC … but CoinList notified everyone they are exiting the US market. I want to be able to keep using the Maker platform to borrow against my WBTC… but am struggling to find a place to wrap my BTC in a cost effective way. Any suggestions out there? Bonus points: It would be great if Maker had an ability on the platform to wrap BTC for its clients someday.

You can use Via Router | Advanced Cross-Chain Liquidity Aggregation Protocol which is a very popular bridge, but as always it is at your own risk. Really the best option seems to be to use Ren protocol and get RenBTC which you can also create a vault or exchange it for WBTC on curve.
